articles.title: Shot in the dark: Early coronavirus vaccine efficacy explained - India Today
articles.description: Some experts say that, ideally, 150 to 160 people in a trial of tens of thousands of participants must get sick before making a reliable assessment of a vaccine’s efficacy. That’s a bit of a rule of thumb, though, open to interpretation.
articles.content: Moderna Inc delivered the latest good news from Covid-19 vaccine developers, saying its experimental vaccine is 94.5% effective in preventing the disease based on interim data from a late-stage trial… [+5607 chars]
